    All Classes and Interfaces

    Class
    Description
    Direction
    This class defines an enumerated type for the directions by which Locations are related and Characters can move.
    DirectionTest
     
    IParserObserver
    For user interfaces that rely on a text parser, this interface provides a means for error messages and command output to come from the parser directly to the UI.
    Item
     
    IWorldObserver
    A class can implement this interface when it wants to be informed of changes in World objects.
    IWorldObserverTest
     
    ParserWorldObserver
    An partial implementation of IParserObserver and IWorldObserver that factors out the common code between graphical and command-line text-based interfaces.
    PersistenceSaveLoadTest
     
    Place
    Represents a place, such as a room or corridor, that a character in the game can travel through.
    PlaceTest
     
    Player
    An avatar that is controlled by, and represents, the user of the game.
    PlayerTest
     
    SmallWorld
    The main program for SmallWorld with a text user interface.
    SmallWorld
    The main program for SmallWorld with a simple graphical user interface.
    TestArrivalWinsGameFeature
     
    TestConstants
     
    TestMovementShortcutFeature
     
    TextUtilities
    A convenience class of handy constants and methods for working with text.
    UserCommandParser
    Parses user commands and informs a specified WorldController instance of its results.
    WordWrappedMessage
    A class that produces word wrapped string messages.
    World
    The simulated world in which simulated players lead their short, simulated lives.
    WorldController
    This class is responsible for executing a user's commands.
    WorldControllerTest
     
    WorldPersistence
    The persistence capability for the game.
    WorldTest
